column1: Pyapon (Burmese: ဖျာပုံမြို့;  Mon: ဖျာ ပုၚ်
column2: [phya pɜŋ]) is a town and seat of Pyapon District in the Ayeyarwady Division of Myanmar
column4: a tributary of the Ayeyarwady River.  It is located about 15 km inland from the Andaman Sea
column5: about 75 miles south of the previous capital
column6: Yangon. It has a population of approximately 300
column7: 000 in 2006. It serves as a center for collecting rice from the surrounding agricultural areas
column8: and is home to a diesel-run power plant
column9: using equipment by the German firm Siemens.
